title: Grammys 2017: The Magic Behind Lady Gaga's Sparkly Performance Eye Makeup
text: February 12, 2017 Getty Images Superbowl 2.0 was the over-arching theme of Lady Gaga 's super-sparkly, rock 'n' roll Grammys 2017 performance, thanks to the return of the singer's statement bejeweled eye makeup. For her big duet date with Metallica, Gaga called on her go-to makeup artist Sarah Nicole Tanno for another show-stopping take at the shimmery eye makeup that sparkled in the LED light reflections during her Superbowl 51 halftime show last weekend. To get the statement shadow look, Tanno colored in Gaga's lids with a suede red eye shadow (Marc Jacobs Beauty Highliner Matte Gel Eye Crayon Eyeliner in (Fine)Wine 47), but didn't stop there. For a more dramatic makeup move, the makeup pro drew the shadow and winged-liner combo (created with the Marc Jacobs Beauty Highliner Gel Eye Crayon Eyeliner in Blacquer 42) out past her eyes in a rounded shape—blending outwards towards the singer's temples. You May Also Like Celebrity Grammys 2017: Katy Perry Wears a "Persist" Armband During Her Performance On top of the merlot base, Tanno swept two lighter pink-y shades—a rosy-copper hybrid shadow (Marc Jacobs Beauty Twinkle Pop Stick Eyeshadow in Leila 416) and a powder-y pink (Marc Jacobs Beauty Highliner Matte Gel Eye Crayon Eyeliner in Pink of Me 59) for a contrasting ombre effect. And once all that pink was in place, Tanno drew out black eyeliner flames (again, using Marc Jacobs Beauty Highliner Gel Eye Crayon Eyeliner in Blacquer 42 ), jazzing up the fiery whorls with sparkly jewels ranging in shades of pink to red.
